data.title: Public Interest Job Opportunities — Impact Fund
data.text:
Why do we require a salary range? If you request a waiver, please email us stating the reasons why you are unable to provide a salary range.

If a salary range is not provided and a waiver is not received, the position will not be posted.

Class action practitioners on our Listserve receive the weekly bulletin. If you would like to receive a weekly email that highlights new postings email Elle.

Impact Fund Class Action Forum – Mid-Week Jobs Service 7.17.24

100 postings this week, with new ones from Northwest Justice Project, Lichten & Liss-Riordan, P.C., American Immigration Council, Missouri State Public Defender, Advancement Project, North Carolina Office of the Appellate Defender, ACLU Foundation of Southern California, Burakiewicz & DePriest, PLLC, New Mexico Law Offices of the Public Defender, GLBTQ Legal Advocates & Defenders, and Los Angeles Center for Law and Justice.

Where the deadline for applications is known, this is at the end of the posting. OUF = Open Until Filled.

Positions are sorted alphabetically by region i.e. West, Midwest, Northeast, South, and Remote.

The Impact Fund Mid-Week Jobs Service is issued each week. If you have a job announcement that you would like to list on this bulletin, please email a brief description of no more than 120 words together with a salary range and web link for more information to egordon@impactfund.org by 5pm Pacific on Tuesday. We kindly ask to be notified once the position has been filled.

Like us, we know you care deeply about avoiding bias in the hiring process. Including a salary range is one of the ways that we can all help minimize implicit bias and set a good example. The Impact Fund Mid-Week Jobs Bulletin is a free service provided by the Impact Fund. To help support this and the other free services provided by the Impact Fund please consider making a contribution to help us cover costs.
